alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 4:08PM EDT until June 06 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 404 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have developed over southern Miami-Dade County and is moving slowly northeast into the southern metro areas of Miami-Dade County. Rainfall amounts from these thunderstorms will be between 1 to 2 inches on top of the already 1 to 3 inches that has fallen over this area from earlier heavy rainfall. The grounds are still very saturated over this area and any additional rainfall can lead to some possible flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Homestead, The Redland, Homestead General Airport, Florida City, Naranja, Leisure City, Richmond West, Princeton, Country Walk, Goulds, Homestead Base, Zoo Miami, West Perrine, Cutler Bay, Palmetto Bay, Everglades National Park, Inlikita, South Miami Heights, Three Lakes and Palmetto Estates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
